critical_sections.name: System Principles (Global Rules)
critical_sections.description: Global rules that apply to all components and specs, including LLM Gateway access, credit auditing, reproducibility, observability, and registry governance
critical_sections.rationale: These are non-negotiable system-wide principles that ensure consistency and governance across the entire platform

critical_sections.name: Cross-Spec Rules (Non-Negotiable)
critical_sections.description: Rules governing how child specs interact with the root spec, preventing redefinition and ensuring inheritance of cross-cutting rules
critical_sections.rationale: These rules maintain the authority of the root spec and prevent conflicts between specifications

critical_sections.name: Spec Governance & Registry Authority
critical_sections.description: Defines the registry as the single source of truth for spec inventory, ownership, status, and lifecycle
critical_sections.rationale: Establishes the governance model and ensures registry authority across all specifications

critical_sections.name: Cross-Cutting Requirements
critical_sections.description: Policy-level requirements for security, observability, and compliance that apply across all components
critical_sections.rationale: These requirements ensure baseline security, observability, and compliance standards are met platform-wide

critical_sections.name: Governance & Quality Bar
critical_sections.description: Quality requirements for generated code including mandatory tests, evidence provision, and production-ready standards
critical_sections.rationale: Establishes the quality bar for all generated artifacts to ensure production readiness
